CONVERSATION.MESSAGE: hmm, seems harder than i thought to come up with evil test cases for reflecting attributes
makes his tokeniser 25% faster by manually buffering the file input stream
Seems like the actual tokenisation takes an almost negligible time, compared to the effort required to shove all the bytes into it
.dir is the only attribute that is limited to only known values? how boring.
has the keywords "1", "a", "A", "i", "I" (are there others?) in current browsers
IE recognises <menu type=disc> and circle and square
